title: Flatpak QSV H264 error encoding

labels.name: Confirmed
labels.description: This bug report has been confirmed by project members

body:
### Operating System Info

Ubuntu 22.10

### Other OS

_No response_

### OBS Studio Version

30.1.0-beta1

### OBS Studio Version (Other)

_No response_

### OBS Studio Log URL

https://obsproject.com/logs/6WMqhVBsBpPue1wC

### OBS Studio Crash Log URL

_No response_

### Expected Behavior

The WHIP stream to start successfully without QSV encoding errors.

### Current Behavior

When starting a WHIP stream with the encoder set to QSV/H.264, the encode will fail with the following.
```
17:50:23.013: [qsv encoder: 'advanced_video_stream'] Encode failed: bad texture handle
17:50:23.013: Error encoding with encoder 'advanced_video_stream'
```
Strangely, when I close OBS, the applications hangs open. When I go to run OBS again via the flatpak, OBS warns that it's already running. I acknowledge by clicking "launch anyway" and continue to launch. When I start streaming in this mode, using QSV/H.264, the stream works just fine.

The above linked log URL is of the failure. Here is a log link of the encoding working when I launch acknowledging that another OBS instance is running. https://obsproject.com/logs/MOWiWFbf0EAKLOHJ

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Set stream output to WHIP (likely not related to issue)
2. Set stream encoder to QSV/H.264 (any settings)
3. Start stream


### Anything else we should know?

I'm using an Intel Arc A380 - driver versions:
```
vainfo: VA-API version: 1.20 (libva 2.20.0)
vainfo: Driver version: Intel iHD driver for Intel(R) Gen Graphics - 23.4.0 ()
```
I also noted this line in the log out, indicating that I'm not on an Intel GPU?
```
app not on intel GPU, fall back to old qsv encoder
```
